hello guys my name is fanny and in this
video I want to talk to you about
communication problems and when you're
an English teacher working abroad or
even if you've traveled you do know that
there are often communication problems
and from my experience as a teacher I
think these problems and often arise
because people try and translate their
mother tongue into English and my main
piece of advice as a teacher to you is
don't do that
don't try and translate because every
language has their own words and
expressions you know and I know that
when you're not that fluent it's it's
reassuring to use your own language and
translate it unfortunately it doesn't
it's not going to work out and so for
example let's just and take an example
I taught em English in France for a few
years and French has a lot of
expressions and we for example say to
get a blue so that's the expression
French I wear hand blue and that means
em to get bruised okay so a bruise in
French is literally a blue so but you
can't say I got a blue if you say I got
a blue you you're actually translating
the exact words from French into English
and I'm not gonna understand what you
mean and I've had people say that I've
had someone one day and say oh I got a
blue and I obviously didn't know what
that meant so and that is something that
you should avoid doing okay and and I
got a story about that for example and I
was correcting an essay once because I
worked in a heist
and some and the student had written you
know an essay in English I think she was
describing a holiday or something and at
some point I can read
Oh on the last day I was so sad and
because I was walking in the garden and
suddenly I fell and broke my face and it
honestly took me a good ten minutes to
understand what she meant
and it's actually because there's an
expression in French okay say that
figure which is literally to break your
face and it means to hurt yourself and
so she wanted to say I was walking in
the garden suddenly I fell and hurt
myself but she translated French into
English you know thinking and and I
guess you know we all think that we all
think oh my language is the reference
it's the standard and every other
language imitates mine and just you know
I can simply translate but unfortunately
and you can't so as a teacher again with
years of experience and please don't try
and do that don't translate your mother
tongue you just have to learn as much as
you can watch films read books try and
understand how people talk
in English you know the expressions that
they use remember them and use them but
don't translate your mother tongue into
English okay I hope this helps and thank
